required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of ALN-AAT02 in Healthy Participants and Participants With ZZ Type Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency Liver Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1/2, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Single-ascending and Multiple-dose, Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics Study of Subcutaneously Administered ALN-AAT02 in Healthy Adult Subjects and Patients With ZZ Type Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency Liver Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of single or multiple doses of ALN-AAT02. The study will be conducted in 2 sequential phases in which Part A will be a single-ascending dose (SAD) phase in healthy participants, and Part B will be a multiple-ascending dose (MAD) phase in participants with ZZ type alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency (PiZZ) and biopsy-proven alpha-1 antitrypsin (AAT) deficiency-associated liver disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: up to approximately 12 months; Part B: up to approximately 18 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Serum Levels of Alpha-1 Antitrypsin (AAT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: baseline up to Day 85 and every 84 days up to approximately 12 months; Part B: baseline up to Day 169 and every 84 days up to approximately 18 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) for ALN-AAT02
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: Days 1, 2, 3, 8 and 15; Part B: Days 1, 2, 3, 29, 85, 86 and 87

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Cmax (tmax) for ALN-AAT02
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: Days 1, 2, 3, 8 and 15; Part B: Days 1, 2, 3, 29, 85, 86 and 87

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Time 0 to the Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) for ALN-AAT02
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: Days 1, 2, 3, 8 and 15; Part B: Days 1, 2, 3, 29, 85, 86 and 87

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Terminal Elimination Half-life (t1/2) for ALN-AAT02
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: Days 1, 2, 3, 8 and 15; Part B: Days 1, 2, 3, 29, 85, 86 and 87

secondary_outcome.measure: Fraction Eliminated in Urine (fe) of ALN-AAT02
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: Day 1; Part B: Days 1 and 85

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of Full Length Drug Excreted in Urine (Ae) of ALN-AAT02
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: Day 1; Part B: Days 1 and 85

clinical_study.condition: ZZ Type Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency Liver Disease

arm_group.description: Participants will be administered a single dose of ALN-AAT02.
Participants will be administered a single dose of matching placebo.
Participants will be administered multiple doses of ALN-AAT02.
Participants will be administered multiple doses of matching placebo.

intervention.description: ALN-AAT02 will be administered subcutaneously (SC) at dose levels planned for Part A.
Sterile normal saline (0.9% NaCl) matching volume of ALN-AAT02 doses will be administered SC.
ALN-AAT02 will be administered subcutaneously (SC). Part B dose levels to be determined upon review of data from Part A.
